text:
The Congress in Arunachal Pradesh on Sunday accused Governor J. P. Rajkhowa of conspiring to help the dissident MLAs form a government with the support of BJP without waiting for a decision of the Supreme Court which is hearing petitions challenging imposition of President’s rule in the State.

Geetartha Darshan Barua, spokesperson for CLP leader and deposed Chief Minister Nabam Tuki, said Deputy Speaker T. N. Thongdok, who is in the dissident camp, has sought the opinion of the State Law Department through the Governor asking if he can function as Deputy Speaker performing the duties of Speaker when President’s rule is in place in the State.

Report sought

Following Thongdok’s letter, the Governor sought a report from the law department on the subject. - PTI
title: ‘Arunachal Governor conspiring with dissident MLAs’
